title: Ticket #3650: DAGMan miscounts held jobs when hold event is duplicated.
description:
The problem can be seen clearly in the attached dagman.out file. Just search for the held job and watch the count.

The underlying problem is that Condor is printing two hold events (#3651) -- but DAGMan should be robust to this since it should know that a job already on hold cannot be put on hold again and counted as an additional held job.
remarks:
2013-May-21 16:22:13 by nwp:
First try at a fix pushed onto V7_9-gittrac_3650-branch

2013-May-24 16:28:41 by wenger:
CODE REVIEW

  • There should be a test -- probably with multiple-job clusters.

  • Job::Hold() and Job::Release() should have doc.

  • Job::_onHold should have doc.

  • Just pass event->proc to Job::Hold and Job::Release() instead of *event (makes it clearer that proc is the only thing we care about inside those methods).

  • I don't think Job::Hold() can ever be called with event == NULL -- change if to assert? (If we continue to pass *event to these methods.)

  • Shouldn't Job::TerminateFailure() also free the _onHold memory?

  • Why not increment Job::_timesHeld inside Job::Hold() instead of in Dag::ProcessHeldEvent()?

  • Print warnings for things like getting a release event for a job proc that was never held or is not currently on hold.
